channel.title: Server code with up to date jad with healers
channel.description: I'm lloking for the best jad out there, it NEEDS to have healers and sounds and animations up to date, it'd also be nice if spawns were correct and you could safespot it realistically. I don't care if you have to go through the 63 waves as long as I can modify the code to remove them. If you know of a server where you can skip all 62 waves to jad and jad has healers and realistic sounds and animations that'd be great. Thanks.

item.title: Server code with up to date jad with healers
item.dc:creator: @zubiri zubiri
item.description:
@zubiri wrote:

thanks I did that but there are no .bats
I called “ant resolve” “ant build” and “ant run” on apollo dir but it gives me an error on “ant run”
It says no index files present, do I need to download or install moparscape or anything?

Read full topic
item.source: Server code with up to date jad with healers

item.title: Server code with up to date jad with healers
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

zubiri:

I have downloaded apollo, is it a server? how do I run it and why does it weigh 700kbs

Use this:

[quote=“Zenocko, post:1, topic:427852”]Purpose: Setup apollo server
Difficulty: 8/10
Knowledge needed: Environmental Variables, CMD prompt
Credits:
Graham for making apollo so damn hard to setup

Pre-tutorial warning: this guide is noob friendly, but it is very long.

Step 1(Download server files):
Download apollo server from here: Apollo - Edited by Zenocko to included 317 cache/batch files
Download a 317 Client from here: 317 client loading 377 cache

Step 2(Download apache/ivy files):
Download apache ant here: Apache Ant 1.8.2
Download apache ivy here: Apache Ivy 2.2.0

Step 3(Setup ant):
Extract apache ant anywhere and put it in C:\Program Files, so it looks like this: C:\Program Files\apache-ant-1.8.2.

Step 4(Install environmental variables for ant):
Go to Start -> [COLOR=red]right-click[/COLOR] My Computer -> Properties

On the properties menu, click [COLOR=red]“Advanced system settings”[/COLOR] on the right.

On the system properties menu, make sure your on the “Advanced” tab. At the bottom, click on [COLOR=red]“Environment Variables…”[/COLOR]

On the Environmental Variables menu, click the [COLOR=red"“New…”[/COLOR] button on the top half.
In the “Variable name:” field put ANT_HOMEIn the “Variable value:” field put the location of your ant directory. Mine is: C:\Program Files\apache-ant-1.8.2 It should look something like this:

[COLOR=red]Repeat that again^[/COLOR] but this time put the “Variable name:” field put JAVA_HOMEIn the “Variable value:” field put the location of your java jdk directory. Mine is: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_25 It should look something like this:

Once you have the ANT_HOME and JAVA_HOME variables declared, look at the bottom half system variables and scroll down to [COLOR=red]“Path”[/COLOR] and click the [COLOR=red]“Edit…”[/COLOR] button.

On the Edit System Variable for Path on the bottom “variable value:” scroll to the end of the value field and add: ;C:\Program Files\apache-ant-1.8.2\bin
Make sure there is a " ; " semicolon between your ant location and whatever was before it. For exmaple: C:\blah\blah\bin;C:\derp\bin;C:\Program Files\apache-ant-1.8.2\bin

[SIZE=“5”]Congrats thats the hard part. [/SIZE]

Step 5(Check to see if ant works):
Open command prompt by pressed start -> search bar -> type “CMD”

In command prompt, type ant. If you get this message then you installed ant correctly

Step 6(Install apache ivy):
Extract apache ivy to wherever. Open the apache ivy folder and copy the jar file in there:

Copy the Ivy jar file and navigate to the apache ant lib folder C:\Program Files\apache-ant-1.8.2\lib directory and paste the ivy jar file in there.

Now that the ivy jar file is in the apache directory. Navigate to your ivy folder again and open up [COLOR=red]src -> example -> hello-ivy[/COLOR]. Once your in the [COLOR=red]hello-ivy[/COLOR] folder[COLOR=red] Hold shift key and right click on your mouse.[/COLOR] Click “Open command window here”

In the command window type ant and press enter. A shit-ton of code should pop-up and after a few seconds it should say “BUILD SUCCESSFUL”

You have now installed apache ivy. Now we can get started on running the server! :drool:

Step 6(Running server):
Extract the apollo.zip file you downloaded in step 1. Open the folder and run “[COLOR=red]resolve.bat[/COLOR]”. You only need to [COLOR=red]run this once[/COLOR], it will download any needed libraries and exit within a few seconds. Now run “[COLOR=red]1Compile.bat[/COLOR]” to compile all of the scripts/files. After compiling, you can run “[COLOR=red]2Run.bat[/COLOR]” to start the server!

Thats it. You can now run/program Graham’s apollo server. Use the compile batch to compile all of your edits, and use the run batch to run the server. These batch files did not come in Graham’s original post, I added them for easy of access. [COLOR=red]To fix the ‘batch files is that some times I will have to open task manager and kill java.exe because the JVM becomes binded to port 43594/43595.’ problem, edit your batch files and add “end” at the bottom after pause(thanks caboose)[/COLOR]

I do not give permission to repost this tutorial anywhere. I have already posted it on mopar, r-s, and rb under my own name.

Post any help questions/comments/ideas here. Rep++ if I helped, spent a good 2 hours on this tut.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.description:

It’s ok sounds aren’t that important either, what source code should I use?
[/quote]

Shard Revolution
Apollo
Hyperion

Take your pic. These might be too advanced for you if you’re just starting. I’d recommend these if you want to actually learn Java though. Jackson, Tyson, Jordan, Game 6[/quote]

item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

zubiri:

sounds?

Honestly players don’t care about this. You’ll need to make them yourself. I believe some higher revisions have sound already, but only some sound. I don’t recommend you skip 317 and move to 474+ by the way.

item.title: Server code with up to date jad with healers
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

[quote=“zubiri, post:7, topic:427678”]Thanks for the insults and so, but you are treating me like if I had any idea of wtf you are talking about, I only get the ID part. I don’t know what that code is nor what you are trying to explain me I should do. I was planning on downloading a source code to start from and reading some tutorials.
If I just start from a vanilla server (like moparscapes homepage) and put jad in the fight cave) will it automatically spawn where runescape spawns it? Will it make the animations and sounds? I have been through some servers where it didn’t do any of these, sometimes it skipped animations etc…
It just seems hard that I can do it better from scratch than what the server coders did.
If someone could give me an idea as to how I can program the jad to be as perfect as possible or give me a source code with a good jad I’d appreciate that.[/quote]
Their is no server that has it 100% like jad on runescape, even with all the waves. Everyone’s server is basically the same, but none are like RuneScape. You would have to code it in to your server if you want it 99% like RuneScape.

Your lucky if you will find a server that even has working healers, because i’ve never seen one.

Read full topic

item.title: Server code with up to date jad with healers
item.dc:creator: @zubiri zubiri
item.description:
@zubiri wrote:

Thanks for the insults and so, but you are treating me like if I had any idea of wtf you are talking about, I only get the ID part. I don’t know what that code is nor what you are trying to explain me I should do. I was planning on downloading a source code to start from and reading some tutorials.
If I just start from a vanilla server (like moparscapes homepage) and put jad in the fight cave) will it automatically spawn where runescape spawns it? Will it make the animations and sounds? I have been through some servers where it didn’t do any of these, sometimes it skipped animations etc…
It just seems hard that I can do it better from scratch than what the server coders did.
If someone could give me an idea as to how I can program the jad to be as perfect as possible or give me a source code with a good jad I’d appreciate that.

item.description:
@zubiri wrote:

[quote=“runescape sucks, post:3, topic:427678”]Their is this really nice server that you can play, but not download…

It’s called RuneScape, it has domain names and about 100+ servers in one! It’s pretty damn awesome

I Believe this one has the best “Jad” I’ve ever seen[/quote]
Your sarcasm isn’t appreciated, I am looking to skip all 62 waves so I can practice jad directly. Unless you can download the source code of the original fight caves and reprogram it to skip 62 waves then your post is useless.

Team_Rocket:

Team_Rocket says: You can just program all of this yourself… I seriously hope nobody just gives this to you. You can easily just get rid of the 62 waves.

Can you expand this? I am a total noob on here, I wouldn’t be programming this from scratch or would I?
